description: This course provides a social science understanding of the "contemporary American family" and
analysis of marriage and family issues from a cross-cultural perspective.  Students discuss issues
of dating and mate selection, marital and parent-child relationships over the family life cycle,
gender issues, work and family roles, and problem-related issues affecting families (divorce,
violence and death) caused by rapid changes in society.  Offered annually in the fall or spring
semester. Counts towards American studies major and family studies concentration.
